function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"AI predictive models trained on Chinese samples may not be generalizable to other populations.","Impact":"Inaccurate predictions and projections based on AI models may lead to misinformed public health decisions.","Mitigation":"Train AI algorithms with diverse and representative datasets from different populations to improve generalizability of predictions.","Technologies":"Diverse and representative COVID-19 datasets for training AI algorithms, data augmentation techniques to enhance dataset diversity.","People":"Public health policymakers, healthcare professionals, and AI researchers.","Owner":"AI researchers, public health organizations, government agencies."},{"Description":"Noise from social media and online traffic may lead to overfitted AI models and inaccurate trend predictions.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of trends and unreliable forecasting of COVID-19 cases and deaths.","Mitigation":"Implement robust data filtering and preprocessing techniques to remove noise from big-data sets before training AI models.","Technologies":"Data preprocessing algorithms, noise filtering techniques, anomaly detection methods.","People":"Data scientists, AI researchers, and machine learning engineers.","Owner":"Data science teams, technology companies, research institutions."},{"Description":"Inadequate screening and testing strategies in some countries may result in underreporting of COVID-19 cases and transmission rates.","Impact":"Underestimation of the true prevalence and transmission dynamics of COVID-19, leading to inadequate public health measures.","Mitigation":"Implement comprehensive and widespread testing strategies for both symptomatic and asymptomatic individuals, use of advanced screening technologies, and data integration for better surveillance.","Technologies":"High-performance thermal cameras, mobile technology for symptom data collection, advanced testing platforms.","People":"Public health authorities, healthcare professionals, and policymakers.","Owner":"Government agencies, public health organizations, medical institutions."}]}
